sentences: D'erlanger (stylized as D'ERLANGER) is a Japanese rock band from Kyoto Prefecture, formed in 1983 by guitarist Cipher and bassist Seela.
While they originally played speed and power metal, after recruiting drummer Tetsu and vocalist Kyo they switched to an alternative rock sound for their debut album La Vie En Rose in 1989.
They released Basilisk in March 1990 and it reached the top five on the charts.
They reunited in 2007 and released the album Lazzaro, with a new harder sound that adds a gothic rock feel.
Formation to disbandment: 1983–1990 ===
D'erlanger was formed in December 1983 by Cipher and Seela on guitar and bass respectively.
They had their first performance in May 1984 at the Osaka Bourbon House, when Cipher was just sixteen years old.
In August 1984, Kaoru left the band and was replaced by Dizzy.
They released 3 demo tapes by 1985, "Tonight", "The Birth of Splendid Beast!!"
On October 26, 1986 they participated in an event at Meguro Rokumeikan, called The New Power Metal Audition.
D'erlanger won the contest and the label released their single "Girl" on February 20, 1987, it was limited to 3000 copies.
On August 1, 1987, D'erlanger had their first one-man concert at Meguro Rokumeikan.
Dizzy then left the band in June 1988 and Kyo, who had previously played with Tetsu in the short-lived Dead Wire and in Saver Tiger, became their new vocalist on July 1.
While touring in 1989, they released their first album La Vie En Rose, with Danger Crue Records on February 10.
On December 24, 1990, D'erlanger shocked their fans by suddenly announcing that they had disbanded.
A home video and two separate live albums entitled Moon and the Memories... the Eternities Last Live 1 and 2 were released on March 6, 1991.
On April 21, 1995, both their studio albums were remastered and re-released.
Reunited: 2007–2012 =
On March 14, 2007, the greatest hits album and DVD Pandora was released.
On September 22, 2007, D'erlanger held Abstinence's Door #001, which was an event where themselves, Mucc and Merry performed.
They released the single "Zakuro" on March 19, 2008.
On July 25, 2009 they played in Taipei, Taiwan.
The band then released their fifth album, the self-titled D'erlanger, on November 11, 2009.

sentences: On September 19 and 20, 2010, Abstinence's Door #005 and Abstinence's Door #006 took place.
D'erlanger announced they would release an album entitled A Fabulous Thing in Rose, on September 29, 2010.
On December 13, it was announced on their official website that D'erlanger would be performing in Moscow, Russia at the XO-Club on April 30, 2011.
However, on March 29, after the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami that occurred on March 11 in Japan, the band decided to postpone the show until a new date can be announced.
They once again returned to Taiwan, this time for a performance at the Hohaiyan Rock Festival on July 15, 2012.
D'erlanger covered "Iconoclasm" for Parade II -Respective Tracks of Buck-Tick-, a tribute album to Buck-Tick, and participated on the album's tour Buck-Tick Fest 2012 On Parade on September 23.
Warner Music Japan: 2013–present ===
D'erlanger released their sixth studio album, #Sixx, on May 22, 2013.
They covered hide's song "Genkai Haretsu" for Tribute VII -Rock Spirits-, released in December 2013.
2014 saw a continuation of the sixth album's tour, titled #Sixx-69-.
Tsuite-, followed on April 22, 2015.
The group released J'aime La Vie on May 3, 2017, which became their highest-charting studio album since reuniting.
A tribute album to the band called D'erlanger Tribute Album ~Stairway to Heaven~ was released on September 13, 2017.
D'erlanger released their ninth album Roneve on May 22, 2019.
On September 14, 2021, D'erlanger announced the postponement of their nationwide Agito Tour, which was set to begin later in the month, so that Kyo could have a tumor on his lung removed.
D'erlanger performed at the Jack in the Box 2021 event on December 27.

They also held a gig in South Korea on October 30.
The album includes a studio version of "Easy Make, Easy Mark", a song they wrote and played back in the '80s.

It contains eleven tracks: 8 self-cover versions of songs from their first 2 studio albums, an English version of "La Vie En Rose", plus the new tracks "Everything is Nothing" (a song they wrote and played back in the '80s) and the instrumental "Adameve".
Although it was on an indie label, it sold out and was reissued three times that year, earning them a major label record deal with BMG Japan the following year.
However, in December the group suddenly announced their disbandment.
They had their first performance in May 1984 at the Osaka Bourbon House, when Cipher was just sixteen years old.
They released 3 demo tapes by 1985, "Tonight", "The Birth of Splendid Beast!!"
They also appeared on the live omnibus album Hungry Days, with the song "Like a Beast".
They then distributed another demo tape for free on February 22, it contained only "Sadistic Emotion".
Soon after Shi-Do decided to leave the band, he was replaced by Tetsu, who was a roadie for 44Magnum alongside Cipher, in October.
Dizzy then left the band in June 1988 and Kyo, who had previously played with Tetsu in the short-lived Dead Wire and in Saver Tiger, became their new vocalist on July 1.
After their first show with Kyo on July 22, they went on their Sadistical Punk Tour.
While touring in 1989, they released their first album La Vie En Rose, with Danger Crue Records on February 10.
All copies were sold out just by pre-orders, so they released another press eleven days later.
The year 1990 started off with the band signing to the major label Ariola, at the time a sub label of BMG.
During their Ai to Shi to Koh-Kotsu Tour at the beginning of 1990, they released their first major single, "Darlin'" on January 25.
On March 7, they released their second album Basilisk.
They released the single "Lullaby -1990-" before starting the Moon and the Memories Tour on September 10.
The tour ended on October 31, at Koseinenkin Kaikan in Osaka.

sentences: All of which were recorded from their penultimate concerts on October 27 and 28, 1990 at Hibiya Open-Air Concert Hall in Tokyo.
Also released that same day on Cutting Edge, a sub label of Avex Group, was D'erlanger's first release of new material in 17 years, their third album Lazzaro.
On April 22, they played their "rejuvenation performance" entitled Bara Iro no Sekai - Rosy Eyesight at Zepp Tokyo, which was released on DVD on September 19.
It includes "Love Anymore", which was first composed by Cipher when he was sixteen years old and included on the "Blue" demo tape under the name "Telephon", with new lyrics by Kyo.
The band released their fourth album The Price of Being a Rose is Loneliness on April 30.
They then embarked on the D'erlanger Tour '08 -A Rose Insane- tour.
The tour started on May 6 with the D'erlanger 25th Anniversary concert at the Nihon Budokan.
Footage from this concert was released on December 10, as the Bara Iro no Jinsei -La Vie en Rose- DVD.
D'erlanger held Abstinence's Door #002 on September 21, Inoran, Merry and heidi.
Abstinence's Door #003 was held on November 8, with the Underneath and La;Cen-zhow.
The following day was Abstinence's Door #004, where lynch., Sadie and the Underneath performed.
D'erlanger performed at the V-Rock Festival '09 on October 24, the show was broadcast live worldwide on the festival's official website.
Head Phones President, defspiral and Girugamesh performed the first night, whereas Acid Android and Pia performed the second night.
Abstinence's Door #007 was held three days later in Taipei, with Taiwanese band Overdose and Korean Pia performing.
On December 13, it was announced on their official website that D'erlanger would be performing in Moscow, Russia at the XO-Club on April 30, 2011.
However, on March 29, after the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami that occurred on March 11 in Japan, the band decided to postpone the show until a new date can be announced.
D'erlanger covered "Iconoclasm" for Parade II -Respective Tracks of Buck-Tick-, a tribute album to Buck-Tick, and participated on the album's tour Buck-Tick Fest 2012 On Parade on September 23.
Their next album, Spectacular Nite -Kuruoshii Yoru ni
On May 2 D'erlanger began a nationwide tour in celebration of their 25th anniversary that finished on June 14 at Akasaka Blitz.
They also performed at the second day of Luna Sea's Lunatic Fest on June 28, as well as at Angelo's annual Intersection of Dogma concert on August 5.
D'erlanger then hosted and performed at Abstinence's Door #008 and #009 at EX Theater Roppongi on September 15 and 16.
and Psycho le Cému perform, while D'erlanger performed with Hyde the first night and Kiyoharu the second.
It was supported by a fifteen-date nationwide tour from May to July.
On September 14, 2021, D'erlanger announced the postponement of their nationwide Agito Tour, which was set to begin later in the month, so that Kyo could have a tumor on his lung removed.
D'erlanger performed at the Jack in the Box 2021 event on December 27.
Nishihiro stated that D'erlanger are still held up as a unique band decades later because each member is distinct and unlike any other musician.
